titleStmt.title: Thomas M. Vincent to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG12098

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 1st - 20th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Primary Source Documents

body.p:
12th
Adjutant General's Office,
Washington, July 20th, 1865.
To His Excellency,
The Governor of Kentucky
Sir:

I have the honor to report, that the following named Officers of the Volunteer forces from the State of Kentucky have been discharged at the dates, and for the causes, set opposite their respective names, viz:
2 Lieut. W. B. Dobbs ✓ 12 Regt. June 14' 1865. Resigned honorably
2 Lieut. Thomas Richards ✓ 26 " " 14 " " "
1 Lieut. Wm Waters ✓ 3 Cavy " 14 " Resigned honorably Disblty.
Capt. James M. Riddell ✓ 55 Regt. May 29 " Resignation accepted Disblty.

I am, Sir,
Very respectfully,
Your Obedt. Servt.
Thomas M Vincent
Assistant Adjutant General.

No 207
Washington City
Report
Resignations &c.
Entered
Recd A G O 25 July 1865
